page.title: 20TRANSPORT: DRAYTON BASSETT
page.content: Most villagers rely on thier own means of transport. There is a single Midland Red bus service to Tamworth once a day and a regular service into Birmingham. The main roads (A5, A453, A4091) pass close by the village. Traffic has increased. Drivers sometimes use the village as a short-cut, upsetting residents as it creares noise and can be dangerous owing to the narrow country lanes and incresed use of farm machinery in the area. There area 2 car parks in the village, by the workingmen's club and the park. There is no railway in the immediate vicinity. The nearest station is Wilnecote (3 miles N.E.) The Birmingham - Fazeley canal built 1783 (1/2 mile E.) is well known for fishing, walks along the tow-path and pleasure cruising holidays.
